title: Realme 14T surfaces early: a 5G phone with an IP69K rating and 100W fast charging
description: Realme’s official storefront on AliExpress has jumped the gun as it posted a landing page for the Realme 14T, along with some details about the phone. A third-party retailer did the same and even included images. Let’s have a look. According to what’s written on the AliExpress page – which may not be 100% accurate! – the 14T will be a dual-SIM phone with 5G connectivity. It will also feature NFC. There is a fingerprint reader, but it's not quite clear whether it's under the display or not (we're not seeing it on the side). The phone will have a 6.6” display with 1,080 x 2,340px...
excerpt: The phone appeared on Realme's store on AliExpress, which may have lifted the veil earlier than the company intended. Realme’s official storefront on...
text: Realme’s official storefront on AliExpress has jumped the gun as it posted a landing page for the Realme 14T, along with some details about the phone. A third-party retailer did the same and even included images. Let’s have a look. According to what’s written on the AliExpress page – which may not be 100% accurate! – the 14T will be a dual-SIM phone with 5G connectivity. It will also feature NFC. There is a fingerprint reader, but it's not quite clear whether it's under the display or not (we're not seeing it on the side). The phone will have a 6.6” display with 1,080 x 2,340px resolution. The selfie camera will be a 32MP unit, while the rear camera will have three modules with a 50MP main (there are no details on the other two). Realme 14T The phone will be powered by a 5,080mAh battery with 100W SuperVOOC charging. And it will be rated IP68 and IP69K, which we have been seeing on more and more Realme phones recently. Leakster @ZionsAnvin shares additional images of the phone and offers alternative specs (the store page might just be a placeholder, which won't be 100% accurate). The Realme 14T will allegedly have a 6.67" 120Hz OLED display with 1080p+ resolution and will be powered by the Dimensity 6300, which was also featured on the Realme 13 and others. The phone will come with 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 128GB or 256GB of UFS 2.2 storage. According to Anvin, the battery will have 6,000mAh capacity and will charge at 45W instead of the 5,080mAh/100W spec listed by the store. Anyway, the phone reportedly measures 163.1 x 75.6 x 7.9mm and weighs 196g. The camera setup will be 50MP (OmniVision OV50D) plus a 2MP helper on the back and a 16MP on the front (Sony IMX480). This too differs from the store specs. The store says “see you in April”, so the official reveal of the Realme 14T is a few weeks out. Source 1 | Source 2 (now deleted) | Source 3
html:
Realme’s official storefront on AliExpress has jumped the gun as it posted a landing page for the Realme 14T, along with some details about the phone. A third-party retailer did the same and even included images. Let’s have a look.

According to what’s written on the AliExpress page – which may not be 100% accurate! – the 14T will be a dual-SIM phone with 5G connectivity. It will also feature NFC. There is a fingerprint reader, but it's not quite clear whether it's under the display or not (we're not seeing it on the side).

The phone will have a 6.6” display with 1,080 x 2,340px resolution. The selfie camera will be a 32MP unit, while the rear camera will have three modules with a 50MP main (there are no details on the other two).


Realme 14T

The phone will be powered by a 5,080mAh battery with 100W SuperVOOC charging. And it will be rated IP68 and IP69K, which we have been seeing on more and more Realme phones recently.

Leakster @ZionsAnvin shares additional images of the phone and offers alternative specs (the store page might just be a placeholder, which won't be 100% accurate). The Realme 14T will allegedly have a 6.67" 120Hz OLED display with 1080p+ resolution and will be powered by the Dimensity 6300, which was also featured on the Realme 13 and others. The phone will come with 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 128GB or 256GB of UFS 2.2 storage.

According to Anvin, the battery will have 6,000mAh capacity and will charge at 45W instead of the 5,080mAh/100W spec listed by the store. Anyway, the phone reportedly measures 163.1 x 75.6 x 7.9mm and weighs 196g. The camera setup will be 50MP (OmniVision OV50D) plus a 2MP helper on the back and a 16MP on the front (Sony IMX480). This too differs from the store specs.

The store says “see you in April”, so the official reveal of the Realme 14T is a few weeks out.

Source 1 | Source 2 (now deleted) | Source 3
